Sportsaholic was developed in 2005 shortly after the launch of Hawkaholic designed for the Jayhawk fanatics at the University of Kansas. Currently Sportsaholic licenses, manufactures, markets, and sells "aholic" merchandise for over 100 different universities and growing. Visit www.sportsaholic.org for more information

Merestone is a multi-faceted meeting and event services company headquartered in Scottsdale, Arizona. With over 30 years of experience in this fast-paced and innovative industry their capabilities and wide range of talented production encompass every aspect of a successful event. Merestone’s core features result from their expertise in the following in-house services: design, video, extensive editing and animation suites, full service scenic shop supporting a creative environments division, audio visual (lighting, audio, projection and special effects) staging and production. Their Unique Speakers Bureau and entertainment profile is a tremendous asset to their line-up of features. Their objective is to fully support your meetings and events to help communicate, inspire or celebrate. Creating a lasting impact on your guests, clients, and company with the execution of your goals is their main priority. Merestone…….when you need to Create. Communicate. Celebrate. Meet. Educate. Elevate.
International Special Events Society of Arizona

Serving on the Board of Directors for the International Special Events Society of Arizona, I was in charge of a number of annual programs that featured industry education, brought in internationally known speakers, and generated funds for the chapter programs and scholarships. The Annual ISES Gala held every year in the Fall was the most notable program attended by event industry professionals from all over Arizona and outlying states.

Storey Pryor...hmmm. I would have to say if I had 1/8th of the creative capacity that Storey had I would be in some sort of creative marketing think tank for the rest of my life and people would pay me to think.  That being said I believe outside of her creativity Storey has a great work ethic, is passionate about what she does and truly cares about the people she works with.  I worked with her for about three years and I was able to see her grow from an intern, to our sales coordinator.  She always suprised me with various ideas that I would not think about and even though I do not work with her today, I still value our friendship and the ideas she still throws my way.  Someday I see her working for a corporation that has KU colors as their own for some odd reason.

February 15, 2010, Storey reported directly to Melissa A.

By far the most influential person I've been fortunate to know and learn from thus far in my career path; attempting to recommend Melissa could turn into a series! I can honestly say that I wouldn't be in the position I am in now if it wasn't for the leadership, support, innovation, and vast realm of knowledge that Melissa posesses. Her ability to successfully multi-task was a true attest to how she formed the ISES Chapter of Arizona, starting the West Valley Events Coalition, while at the same time opening University of Phoenix Stadium as the Director of Sales. From her expertise in marketing, abiltity to think entirely outside of the box to her incredible energy and work ethic - she's completely deserving of my highest recommendation! I'm her biggest fan, and I hope someday our career paths cross again - not only as a boss/mentor - but as one of my dearest friends!
Melissa A. Jurcan, CSEP

summary: Isagenix International, LLC is a global health and wellness network marketing company based out of Gilbert, Arizona.  As events drive the platform for which Isagenix stands, there are over 60 events a year to learn, grow, create and celebrate physical and financial success through Isagenix. As Director of Events, Storey oversees the following departments on the events team:-Events Communication-Events Destination Management-Events Operations-Events Content and Training
